CHAT: Chat with your collaborator by typing in this box!
AUTH: Please authorize this app in order to save and share your work.
INTERRUPTS_ATTACH_TOOLTIP: The first parameter to attachInterrupt is an interrupt number.
INTERRUPTS_TOOLTIP: Re-enables interrupts (after they've been disabled by noInterrupts()).
INTERRUPTS_NO_TOOLTIP: Disables interrupts (you can re-enable them with interrupts()).
IR_REMOTE_GET: get new button press on pin
IR_REMOTE_TOOLTIP_GET: Poll for a new button input on the given pin.
IR_REMOTE_TOOLTIP_BUTTON_UP: The up arrow on the remote.
IR_REMOTE_TOOLTIP_BUTTON_DOWN: The down arrow on the remote.
IR_REMOTE_TOOLTIP_BUTTON_LEFT: The left arrow on the remote.
IR_REMOTE_TOOLTIP_BUTTON_RIGHT: The right arrow on the remote.
IR_REMOTE_TOOLTIP_BUTTON_SELECT: The select button on the remote (the circle in the middle of the arrows).
GROVE_LIGHT_SENSOR_TOOLTIP: output Low Value in bright light. High Value is darkness.
GROVE_TILT_SWITCH_TOOLTIP: When the switch is level it is open, and when tilted, the switch closes.
GROVE_BUZZER_TOOLTIP: Emit a tone when the output is high
GROVE_RELAY_TOOLTIP: Capable of switching much higher voltages and currents, up to a max of 250V at 10 amps.
GROVE_TEMP_SENSOR_TOOLTIP: return number of ambient temperature in ℃
GROVE_SOUND_SENSOR_TOOLTIP: Detect the sound strength of the environment
GROVE_RGB_LCD_BEGIN_WARNING: Need to install the Grove_LCD_RGB_Backlight library.
GROVE_RGB_LCD_BEGIN_TOOLTIP: Initializes the interface to the LCD screen, and specifies the dimensions (width and height) of the display.
GROVE_RGB_LCD_CLEAR_TOOLTIP: Clears the LCD screen and positions the cursor in the upper-left corner.
GROVE_RGB_LCD_SCROLL_DISPLAY_LEFT_TOOLTI: Scrolls the contents of the display (text and cursor) one space to the left.
GROVE_RGB_LCD_SCROLL_DISPLAY_RIGHT_TOOLT: Scrolls the contents of the display (text and cursor) one space to the right.
GROVE_RGB_LCD_AUTOSCROLL_TOOLTIP: Turns on automatic scrolling of the LCD.
GROVE_RGB_LCD_NOAUTOSCROLL_TOOLTIP: Turns off automatic scrolling of the LCD.
GROVE_RGB_LCD_LEFTTORIGHT_TOOLTIP: Set the direction for text written to the LCD to left-to-right, the default.
GROVE_RGB_LCD_RIGHTTOLEFT_TOOLTIP: Set the direction for text written to the LCD to right-to-left (the default is left-to-right).
GROVE_IR_RECEIVER_INIT_WARNING: Need to install the (Grove) IRSendRev Library.
GROVE_IR_EMITTER_WARNING: Need to install the (Grove) IRSendRev Library.
COLOUR_PICKER_TOOLTIP: Choose a colour from the palette.
COLOUR_RGB_TOOLTIP: Create a colour with the specified amount of red, green, and blue. All values must be between 0 and 100.
COLOUR_BLEND_TOOLTIP: Blends two colours together with a given ratio (0.0 - 1.0).
CONTROLS_WHILE_TOOLTIP: while loops will loop continuously, and infinitely, until the expression inside the parenthesis, () becomes false.
CONTROLS_WHILEUNTIL_TOOLTIP_WHILE: While a value is true, then do some statements.
CONTROLS_WHILEUNTIL_TOOLTIP_UNTIL: While a value is false, then do some statements.
CONTROLS_FOR_TOOLTIP: Have the variable %1 take on the values from the start number to the end number, counting by the specified interval, and do the specified blocks.
CONTROLS_FOREACH_TOOLTIP: For each item in a list, set the variable '%1' to the item, and then do some statements.
CONTROLS_FLOW_STATEMENTS_OPERATOR_CONTIN: continue with next iteration of loop
CONTROLS_FLOW_STATEMENTS_TOOLTIP_BREAK: Break out of the containing loop.
CONTROLS_FLOW_STATEMENTS_TOOLTIP_CONTINU: Skip the rest of this loop, and continue with the next iteration.
CONTROLS_FLOW_STATEMENTS_WARNING: Warning: This block may only be used within a loop.
CONTROLS_IF_TOOLTIP_1: If a value is true, then do some statements.
CONTROLS_IF_TOOLTIP_2: If a value is true, then do the first block of statements. Otherwise, do the second block of statements.
CONTROLS_IF_TOOLTIP_3: If the first value is true, then do the first block of statements. Otherwise, if the second value is true, do the second block of statements.
CONTROLS_IF_TOOLTIP_4: If the first value is true, then do the first block of statements. Otherwise, if the second value is true, do the second block of statements. If none of the values are true, do the last block of statements.
CONTROLS_IF_IF_TOOLTIP: Add, remove, or reorder sections to reconfigure this if block.
CONTROLS_IF_ELSEIF_TOOLTIP: Add a condition to the if block.
CONTROLS_IF_ELSE_TOOLTIP: Add a final, catch-all condition to the if block.
CONTROLS_RETURN_TOOLTIP: Terminate a function and return a value from a function to the calling function, if desired.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_EQ: Return true if both inputs equal each other.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_NEQ: Return true if both inputs are not equal to each other.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_LT: Return true if the first input is smaller than the second input.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_LTE: Return true if the first input is smaller than or equal to the second input.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_GT: Return true if the first input is greater than the second input.
LOGIC_COMPARE_TOOLTIP_GTE: Return true if the first input is greater than or equal to the second input.
LOGIC_OPERATION_TOOLTIP_AND: Return true if both inputs are true.
LOGIC_OPERATION_TOOLTIP_OR: Return true if at least one of the inputs is true.
LOGIC_NEGATE_TOOLTIP: Returns true if the input is false. Returns false if the input is true.
LOGIC_TERNARY_TOOLTIP: Check the condition in 'test'. If the condition is true, returns the 'if true' value; otherwise returns the 'if false' value.
MATH_ARITHMETIC_TOOLTIP_ADD: Return the sum of the two numbers.
MATH_ARITHMETIC_TOOLTIP_MINUS: Return the difference of the two numbers.
MATH_ARITHMETIC_TOOLTIP_MULTIPLY: Return the product of the two numbers.
MATH_ARITHMETIC_TOOLTIP_DIVIDE: Return the quotient of the two numbers.
MATH_ARITHMETIC_TOOLTIP_MODULO: Return the remainder when one integer is divided by another.
MATH_ARITHMETIC_TOOLTIP_POWER: Return the first number raised to the power of the second number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_ROOT: Return the square root of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_ABS: Return the absolute value of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_NEG: Return the negation of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_LN: Return the natural logarithm of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_LOG10: Return the base 10 logarithm of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_EXP: Return e to the power of a number.
MATH_SINGLE_TOOLTIP_POW10: Return 10 to the power of a number.
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_SIN: Return the sine of a degree (not radian).
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_COS: Return the cosine of a degree (not radian).
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_TAN: Return the tangent of a degree (not radian).
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_ASIN: Return the arcsine of a number.
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_ACOS: Return the arccosine of a number.
MATH_TRIG_TOOLTIP_ATAN: Return the arctangent of a number.
MATH_CONSTANT_TOOLTIP: Return one of the common constants: π (3.141…), e (2.718…), φ (1.618…), sqrt(2) (1.414…), sqrt(½) (0.707…), or ∞ (infinity).
MATH_IS_TOOLTIP: Check if a number is an even, odd, prime, whole, positive, negative, or if it is divisible by certain number. Returns true or false.
MATH_ROUND_TOOLTIP: Round a number up or down.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_SUM: Return the sum of all the numbers in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_MIN: Return the smallest number in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_MAX: Return the largest number in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_AVERAGE: Return the average (arithmetic mean) of the numeric values in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_MEDIAN: Return the median number in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_MODE: Return a list of the most common item(s) in the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_STD_DEV: Return the standard deviation of the list.
MATH_ONLIST_TOOLTIP_RANDOM: Return a random element from the list.
MATH_MODULO_TOOLTIP: Return the remainder from dividing the two numbers.
MATH_CONSTRAIN_TOOLTIP: Constrain a number to be between the specified limits (inclusive).
MATH_RANDOM_INT_TOOLTIP: Return a random integer between the two specified limits, inclusive.
MATH_RANDOM_FLOAT_TOOLTIP: Return a random fraction between 0.0 (inclusive) and 1.0 (exclusive).
MATH_POW_TOOLTIP: Calculates the value of a number raised to a power.
TEXT_TEXT_TOOLTIP: A letter, word, or line of text.
TEXT_JOIN_TOOLTIP: Create a piece of text by joining together any number of items.
TEXT_CREATE_JOIN_TOOLTIP: Add, remove, or reorder sections to reconfigure this text block.
TEXT_CREATE_JOIN_ITEM_TOOLTIP: Add an item to the text.
TEXT_LENGTH_TOOLTIP: Returns the number of letters (including spaces) in the provided text.
TEXT_ISEMPTY_TOOLTIP: Returns true if the provided text is empty.
TEXT_INDEXOF_TOOLTIP: Returns the index of the first/last occurrence of first text in the second text. Returns 0 if text is not found.
TEXT_CHARAT_TOOLTIP: Returns the letter at the specified position.
TEXT_GET_SUBSTRING_TOOLTIP: Returns a specified portion of the text.
TEXT_GET_SUBSTRING_START_FROM_END: get substring from letter # from end
TEXT_CHANGECASE_TOOLTIP: Return a copy of the text in a different case.
TEXT_TRIM_TOOLTIP: Return a copy of the text with spaces removed from one or both ends.
TEXT_TRIM_OPERATOR_BOTH: trim spaces from both sides of
TEXT_TRIM_OPERATOR_LEFT: trim spaces from left side of
TEXT_TRIM_OPERATOR_RIGHT: trim spaces from right side of
TEXT_PRINT_TOOLTIP: Print the specified text, number or other value.
TEXT_PROMPT_TOOLTIP_NUMBER: Prompt for user for a number.
TEXT_PROMPT_TOOLTIP_TEXT: Prompt for user for some text.
LISTS_CREATE_EMPTY_TOOLTIP: Returns a list, of length 0, containing no data records
LISTS_CREATE_WITH_TOOLTIP: Create a list with any number of items.
LISTS_CREATE_WITH_CONTAINER_TOOLTIP: Add, remove, or reorder sections to reconfigure this lists block.
LISTS_CREATE_WITH_ITEM_TOOLTIP: Add an item to the lists.
LISTS_REPEAT_TOOLTIP: Creates a list consisting of the given value repeated the specified number of times.
LISTS_REPEAT_TITLE: create list with item %1 repeated %2 times
LISTS_LENGTH_TOOLTIP: Returns the length of a list.
LISTS_TOOLTIP: Returns true if the list is empty.
LISTS_INDEX_OF_TOOLTIP: Returns the index of the first/last occurrence of the item in the list. Returns 0 if text is not found.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_FROM_START: Returns the item at the specified position in a list. #1 is the first item.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_FROM_END: Returns the item at the specified position in a list. #1 is the last item.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_FIRST: Returns the first item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_LAST: Returns the last item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_RANDOM: Returns a random item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_REMOVE_FROM_: Removes and returns the item at the specified position in a list. #1 is the first item.
Removes and returns the item at the specified position in a list. #1 is the last item.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_REMOVE_FIRST: Removes and returns the first item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_REMOVE_LAST: Removes and returns the last item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_GET_REMOVE_RANDO: Removes and returns a random item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_REMOVE_FROM_STAR: Removes the item at the specified position in a list. #1 is the first item.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_REMOVE_FROM_END: Removes the item at the specified position in a list. #1 is the last item.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_REMOVE_FIRST: Removes the first item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_REMOVE_LAST: Removes the last item in a list.
LISTS_GET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_REMOVE_RANDOM: Removes a random item in a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_SET_FROM_START: Sets the item at the specified position in a list. #1 is the first item.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_SET_FROM_END: Sets the item at the specified position in a list. #1 is the last item.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_SET_FIRST: Sets the first item in a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_SET_LAST: Sets the last item in a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_SET_RANDOM: Sets a random item in a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_INSERT_FROM_STAR: Inserts the item at the specified position in a list. #1 is the first item.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_INSERT_FROM_END: Inserts the item at the specified position in a list. #1 is the last item.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_INSERT_FIRST: Inserts the item at the start of a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_INSERT_LAST: Append the item to the end of a list.
LISTS_SET_INDEX_TOOLTIP_INSERT_RANDOM: Inserts the item randomly in a list.
LISTS_GET_SUBLIST_TOOLTIP: Creates a copy of the specified portion of a list.
LISTS_SPLIT_TOOLTIP_SPLIT: Split text into a list of texts, breaking at each delimiter.
LISTS_SPLIT_TOOLTIP_JOIN: Join a list of texts into one text, separated by a delimiter.
VARIABLES_GET_TOOLTIP: Returns the value of this variable.
VARIABLES_SET_TOOLTIP: Sets this variable to be equal to the input.
PROCEDURES_DEFNORETURN_TOOLTIP: Creates a function with no output.
PROCEDURES_DEFRETURN_TOOLTIP: Creates a function with an output.
PROCEDURES_DEF_DUPLICATE_WARNING: Warning: This function has duplicate parameters.
PROCEDURES_CALLRETURN_TOOLTIP: Run the user-defined function '%1' and use its output.
PROCEDURES_MUTATORCONTAINER_TOOLTIP: Add, remove, or reorder inputs to this function.
PROCEDURES_MUTATORARG_TOOLTIP: Add an input to the function.
PROCEDURES_IFRETURN_TOOLTIP: If a value is true, then return a second value.
PROCEDURES_IFRETURN_WARNING: Warning: This block may be used only within a function definition.
INOUT_DIGITAL_WRITE_TOOLTIP: Write digital value to a specific Port.
INOUT_ENABLE_INTERNAL_PULLUP_TOOLTIP: Enable internal pullup resistor of about 50KΩ.
INOUT_ANALOG_WRITE_TOOLTIP: Write analog value between 0 and 255 to a specific Port.
INOUT_TONE_TOOLTIP: The pin can be connected to a piezo buzzer or other speaker to play tones.
INOUT_PULSEIN_TOOLTIP: Reads a pulse (either HIGH or LOW) on a pin.
SERIAL_PRINT_TOOLTIP: Prints data to the console/serial port as human-readable ASCII text.
SERIAL_READ_TOOLTIP: the first byte of incoming serial data available (or -1 if no data is available).
SERIAL_AVAILABLE_TOOLTIP: Get the number of bytes (characters) available for reading from the serial port.
SERIAL_PRINTLN_TOOLTIP: Prints data to the serial port as human-readable ASCII text followed by a carriage return character and a newline character.
TIMES_DELAY_TOOLTIP: Pauses the program for the amount of time (in milliseconds) specified as parameter.
TIMES_MICROS_TOOLTIP: Returns the number of microseconds since the Arduino board began running the current program.
TIMES_DELAYMICROSECONDS_TOOLTIP: Pauses the program for the amount of time (in microseconds) specified as parameter.
TIMES_MILLIS_TOOLTIP: Returns the number of milliseconds since the Arduino board began running the current program.
MATH_RANDOM_MAX_MIN_TOOLTIP: The random function generates pseudo-random numbers.
MATH_MAP_TOOLTIP: Re-maps a number from one range to another.
LCD_INIT_TOOLTIP: Creates a variable of type LiquidCrystal.
LCD_BEGIN_TOOLTIP: Initializes the interface to the LCD screen, and specifies the dimensions (width and height) of the display.
LCD_CLEAR_TOOLTIP: Clears the LCD screen and positions the cursor in the upper-left corner.
LCD_SCROLL_DISPLAY_LEFT_TOOLTIP: Scrolls the contents of the display (text and cursor) one space to the left.
LCD_SCROLL_DISPLAY_RIGHT_TOOLTIP: Scrolls the contents of the display (text and cursor) one space to the right.
LCD_AUTOSCROLL_TOOLTIP: Turns on automatic scrolling of the LCD.
LCD_NOAUTOSCROLL_TOOLTIP: Turns off automatic scrolling of the LCD.
LCD_LEFTTORIGHT_TOOLTIP: Set the direction for text written to the LCD to left-to-right, the default.
LCD_RIGHTTOLEFT_TOOLTIP: Set the direction for text written to the LCD to right-to-left (the default is left-to-right).
ARRAY_CREATE_WITH_TOOLTIP: Create an array with any number of items.
ARRAY_CREATE_WITH_CONTAINER_TOOLTIP: Add, remove, or reorder sections to reconfigure this array block.
ARRAY_CREATE_WITH_ITEM_TOOLTIP: Add an item to the array.
CAST_NUMBER_TOOLTIP: The cast operator translates one variable type into another and forces calculations to be performed in the cast type.
INITIALIZES_SETUP_TOOLTIP: The setup() function is called when a sketch starts.
DHT_READ_TOOLTIP: The DHT sensors are made of two parts, a capacitive humidity sensor and a thermistor.
RGBLED_BEGIN_WARNING: Need to install the Adafruit_NeoPixel Library.
RGBLED_CUSTOM_SETPIXELCOLOR_TOOLTIP: pixels.Color takes RGB values, from 0,0,0 up to 255,255,255
RGBLED_SHOW_TOOLTIP: This sends the updated pixel color to the hardware.
NEOPIXEL_BEGIN_WARNING: Need to install the Adafruit_NeoPixel Library.
NEOPIXEL_CUSTOM_SETPIXELCOLOR_TOOLTIP: pixels.Color takes RGB values, from 0,0,0 up to 255,255,255
NEOPIXEL_SHOW_TOOLTIP: This sends the updated pixel color to the hardware.
SERVO_ATTACH_TOOLTIP: Attach the Servo variable to a pin.
SERVO_WRITE_TOOLTIP: Writes a value to the servo, controlling the shaft accordingly.
SERVO_WRITE_US_TOOLTIP: Writes a value in microseconds(μs) to the servo, controlling the shaft accordingly.
SERVO_READ_TOOLTIP: Read the current angle of the servo (the value passed to the last call to write()).
SERVO_ATTACHED_TOOLTIP: Check whether the Servo variable is attached to a pin.
SERVO_DETACH_TOOLTIP: Detach the Servo variable from its pin.
I2C_MATRIX_BEGIN_WARNING: Need to install the Adafruit-LED-Backpack-Library and the Adafruit-GFX-Library.
I2C_SEVENSEG_BEGIN_WARNING: Need to install the Adafruit-LED-Backpack-Library and the Adafruit-GFX-Library
HT1632_MATRIX_BEGIN_WARNING: Need to install the Adafruit "HT1632" and "GFX" libraries.
ETHERNET_BEGIN_DHCP_TOOLTIP: Using Ethernet.begin(mac) with the proper network setup, the Ethernet shield will automatically obtain an IP address.
ETHERNET_BEGIN_TOOLTIP: Initializes the Ethernet library and network settings.
ETHERNET_LOCALIP_TOOLTIP: Returns the IP address of the Ethernet shield
ETHERNET_AVAILABLE_TOOLTIP: Returns the number of bytes available for reading (that is, the amount of data that has been written to the client by the server it is connected to).
ETHERNET_CONNECTED_TOOLTIP: Returns true if the client is connected, false if not.
ETHERNET_CONNECT_TOOLTIP: Connects to a specified IP address and port. The return value indicates success or failure. Also supports DNS lookups when using a domain name.
ETHERNET_CLIENT_PRINT_TOOLTIP: Print data to the server that a client is connected to. Prints numbers as a sequence of digits, each an ASCII character (e.g. the number 123 is sent as the three characters '1', '2', '3').
ETHERNET_CLIENT_PRINTLN_TOOLTIP: Print data, followed by a carriage return and newline, to the server a client is connected to. Prints numbers as a sequence of digits, each an ASCII character (e.g. the number 123 is sent as the three characters '1', '2', '3').
ETHERNET_READ_TOOLTIP: Read the next byte received from the server the client is connected to (after the last call to read()).
IFTTT_GET_URL_TOOLTIP: Create GET Request URL of IFTTT.
SHEILD_BOT_WARNING: Need to install Shield Bot 1.2 library
SHIELD_BOT_SETMAXSPEED_TOOLTIP: Set max speed of two motors. Between 0(basically off) and 255(full speed)
SHIELD_BOT_SETMAXSPEED_LR_TOOLTIP: Write a max speed to the left and right motor. Between 0(basically off) and 255(full speed)
SHIELD_BOT_MOTOR_TOOLTIP: Enables the right or left motor, negative for backwards, positive for forwards.
SHIELD_BOT_DRIVE_TOOLTIP: All-purpose drive call. Calls leftMotor and rightMotor directly.
SHIELD_BOT_FASTSTOP_TOOLTIP: Disables the motor quicker. This is considered possibly bad for the motor chip so use at your discretion.
SHIELD_BOT_FASTSTOP_LEFTTOOLTIP: Disables the left motor quicker. This is considered possibly bad for the motor chip so use at your discretion.
SHIELD_BOT_FASTSTOP_RIGHT_TOOLTIP: Disables the right motor quicker. This is considered possibly bad for the motor chip so use at your discretion.
SHIELD_BOT_READ_SENSOR_TOOLTIP: Reads any of the 5 light sensors on board.
MPR121_BEGIN_WARNING: Need to install the Adafruit_MPR121 library.
